http.title: Mozilla guide to HTTP
http.description: Home page with references to all things HTTP

http.title: An overview of HTTP
http.description: High level overview covering the core concepts of HTTP

http.title: HTTP Headers
http.description: Explanation of HTTP Headers. You will need to understand what the key ones mean and how they can be used at both the client and the server.  If you ever go on to build a web based API you may choose to incorporate custom headers

http.title: HTTP Methods
http.description: Explanation of HTTP Methods. You will need to understand what the key ones mean.  As you progress to learning about REST and building Restful APIs this information is absolutely required

http.title: HTTP Status
http.description: Explanation of HTTP Status. Status codes are used to convey the outcome of a request.  Apps can react differently to handle different response codes especially so in error handling scenarios

http.title: Access-Control and CORS
http.description: Explanation of Access-Control and CORS. First thing most likely to trip you up in your web development journey

http.title: Analysing a network trace for a web application in Google Chrome
http.description:
Now you know all about HTTP, you should learn about the client side tooling to assist with network analysis.  
Once you've completed all of the above reading, go to your favourite website, turn on the chrome developer tools and analyse the network trace.  Look at the request details including headers, response and action details

xml.title: XML Namespaces
xml.description: Namespaces are an important feature of XML allowing us to clearly delineate which elements belong to which definition

javascript.title: First Steps
javascript.description: Gets you up to speed with fundamental basics of Javascript development

javascript.title: Building Blocks
javascript.description: Introduces you to conditions, loops, functions and events

javascript.title: Variable Scope
javascript.description: Really important topic and all part of the basics

javascript.title: Closures
javascript.description: More fun to mess with your mind and extends on variable scope

javascript.title: Class vs Prototype Inheritance
javascript.description: Prototype inheritance in Javascript is a bit weird and this article explains and compares to class based inheritance  in Java

javascript.title: Binding with Object.bind
javascript.description: This is one of the most important things to understand and learn due to the asynchronous nature of JavaScript

javascript.title: Promises
javascript.description: Another cool feature often used as an alternative to Call Back functions and Events

rest.title: Intro to REST
rest.description: Not usually an advocate of Wikipedia, as a reliable information source, however this is the simplest explanation I can find

rest.title: Apigee Web API Design Book
rest.description: A free eBook describe various practices in the design of restful APIs.  More focussed on service development but handy to understand different implementation styles from a service consumption perspective

jsbin.title: jsbin
jsbin.description: A simple web based IDE for developing mini web apps for POC and training purposes.  Use this when starting out.  You can also use it to share your code (Do this for cool things you make and the things you break)
